user: what is the functions in python?
bot:
In the context of programming, a function in Python is a named sequence of statements that performs a computation. When you define a function, you specify the name and the sequence of statements. Later, you can “call” the function by name. The name of the function is followed by parentheses, which may contain arguments. The result, if any, is called the return value.

Functions in Python can be built-in (provided by Python) or user-defined (created by the programmer). They help in organizing code, making it more modular, reusable, and easier to understand.
